item.name: Block Changes in Last 5 Min
item.description: Closely related to "consistent changes", this statistic counts the total number of changes that were part of an update or delete operation that were made to all blocks in the SGA. Such changes generate redo log entries and hence become permanent changes to the database if the transaction is committed. This approximates total database work. It statistic indicates the rate at which buffers are being dirtied

item.name: Block Gets in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of times a CURRENT block was requested

item.name: Cache Hit Ratio in Last 5 Min
item.description: If cache_hit_ratio is too low, it indicate buffer is too small or too many full can on table.

item.name: Consistent Changes in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of times a user process has applied rollback entries to perform a consistent read on the block.The value of this statistic should be small in relation to the "consistent gets" statistic.

item.name: Consistent Gets in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of times a consistent read was requested for a block.

item.name: Physical Reads in Last 5 Min
item.description: Total number of data blocks read from disk. This value can be greater than the value of "physical reads direct" plus "physical reads cache" as reads into process private buffers also included in this statistic.

item.name: Redo Buffer Allocation Retries in Last 5 Min
item.description: Total number of retries necessary to allocate space in the redo buffer. Retries are needed either because the redo writer has fallen behind or because an event such as a log switch is occurring.

item.name: User Commits in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of user commits. When a user commits a transaction, the redo generated that reflects the changes made to database blocks must be written to disk. Commits often represent the closest thing to a user transaction rate.

item.name: Blks Fetches in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of disk block fetch requests found in disk for database

item.name: Blks Hits in Last 5 Min
item.description: Number of disk block fetch requests found in disk for database

item.name: Buffers Written for New
item.description: Number of buffers written by backends because they needed to allocate a new buffer

item.name: Buffer Writes for Clean
item.description: Number of buffers written by the background writer for routine cleaning of dirty pages.

item.name: Buffer Writes Stopped for Clean
item.description: Number of times the background writer has stopped its cleaning scan because it has written more buffers than specified in the bgwriter_lru_maxpages parameter.

item.name: Master Host
item.description: Master Host. If it's master, then master host is "me".

trigger.name: ElasticSearch might be down
trigger.description: Could not retrieve data. elasticsearch might be down.

trigger.name: Oracle Unreachable
trigger.description: Could not query Oracle server information, the server might be down

trigger.name: Redis master has changed
trigger.description: Previous Master Host differs from the recent one. The previous master instance might be down.
